reviewText: Not at all impressive. I went into it with an open mind and expecting nothing more than a simple puzzle game. But it feels like a mobile port and the puzzle design is extremely focused on trial and error with buttons that will randomly kill you. It is probably a good way to get people to buy more gold coins for a mobile game but its simply bothersome on the pc. Being forced to smash a bunch of barrels in every room you enter is also not that fun. The puzzles that i encountered in the game were very basic and some of them was just strangely designed.  Combine that with a annoying camera that sometimes wont let you see the puzzle components when you aren't pressing the buttons and you get a pretty boring and cheap puzzle game.

reviewText:
Dungeon Lurk II - Leona
Leona is the terrible version of Lara Croft...
PROS  The decisions you have to make in this game are hilariously bad. CONS  There is no way to save your progress.
The game expects you to do it in one sitting.
The game crashes (?).
The graphic choices don't really tell you a distinct difference.
If you are out of in game money then you have to start all over.This game is clearly for phones or tablets.

reviewText:
This is a good old school dungeon crawl/adventure game that requires a lot of patience in the beginning stages, but the payoff is good.

You find yourself in a dungeon with nothing in the way of supplies or money so you just start looking around to determine your best manner of escape. There are lots of containers to break that offer coins or, rarely, other items needed (sometimes an extra life), so break them all because the coins can be used to buy extra lives.

Move carefully because you can take a game-ending fall which will mean you must start at the most recent checkpoint (hopefully, you'll remember where you were beyond that point). Unfortunately, the checkpoints, once used, are gone.

There are puzzles to solve, and monsters to defeat ---- but none are particularly difficult.

The graphics are a bit dated, but the play is smooth enough with enough visual clues so you can find your way to the next objective.

I see that some are unhappy that you are returned to the beginning of the game if you stop for a break, and it took a while to figure out that you have to complete an entire level before the game saves your progress. I don't like that, either, but at least you will be returned to the beginning of the level, not the beginning of the game.

All in all, the game is fun to play (once you figure out a few of its strange nuances), so because it doesn't allow saving wherever you are I recommend it with a bit of reservation. Maybe the devs will polish it up a bit later on. Might be best bought on sale until this happens.

reviewText:
Poorly designed game. Not compelling. in the least.
You are forced into top-down perspective. No option.
The designer has a habit of grabbing the camera and dragging your eyes through their idea of what you should be doing, and it's enough to give you motion sickness.

♥♥♥♥♥ game, poorly planned, poorly executed.
